Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: Hmm, the user wants 20 open-ended questions about a complex multinational supply chain process for smartphone manufacturing. The questions should focus on insights, potential issues, improvement strategies, and decision implications. No SQL queries allowed.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Okay, first I need to break down the supply chain into key areas: RD, sourcing, manufacturing, logistics, distribution, and dataanalytics. The questions should cover each of these areas while encouraging deep thinking about interdependencies and trade-offs.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: For RD, questions could explore how design choices impact the entire supply chain. For sourcing, it is important to address risks in global supplier networks. Manufacturing questions should consider flexibility and quality control. Logistics needs focus on resilience and cost-speed trade-offs. Distribution should examine regional strategies and last-mile challenges. Finally, data and analytics questions should tie everything together with predictive insights and system integration.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The questions must be open-ended, so I will avoid yesno formats and instead use how, what, or in what ways starters. Each question should prompt consideration of multiple factors rather than a single answer. I will ensure they are thought-provoking by including elements like trade-offs, future scenarios, and hidden costs.
